content.description: Start on Our Lady of the Crags and split left after clipping the 5th bolt.  Follow pockets, crimps, and slopers straight up the center of the steep face.  There's a crux half way up the face and another (harder) crux after the last bolt.
content.location: On the west-facing cliff to the right of Altaworld and Silver Soul.  Speculator splits left from Our Lady of the Crags.

content.description: Shares a hard start with Altaworld then splits right after clipping the 3rd bolt to follow a diagonal line of nice pockets and slopers that make a sweeping curve up the right side of the wall.  This climb feels a bit less sustained than Altaworld in the middle but has a steeper, more intense finish.

climbs.name: Our Lady of the Crags
climbs.fa: O. Casal, T. Hurst, T&M. Hammond

content.description: Climb 40 feet of low-angle rock past 4 bolts and then the fun begins as you work to get established on the prominent overhanging arête. The line generally follows a weakness on the left side of the arête. An upper crux guards the first set of chains which is the .11a finish. Some people climbing this for a warm up have opted to stop at this first set of anchors, but it can be fun to continue with an airy leftward shuffle along the lip past another bolt to Speculator's anchor. Climbing the extension bumps it up maybe to .11b: no hard moves, just extra steep jugs that pump the right arm.
content.protection: 9 bolts to chains.  Two extra draws if you're doing the extension.
content.location: On the big arete east of Altaworld and Silver Soul.

content.description: Juggy climbing, long blind reaches, and fun mantels up two big overhangs. The crux involves a reachy move to a well-hidden jug pocket above the second overhang.  Bad rock on the first 20 feet but it gets much better above that.  Great views on top.
content.protection: 9 bolts to chains.  Longer draws on the 2nd and 3rd bolts will prevent rope drag over the roof.   If you're leaving the draws in for more laps, unclip the rope from some of them as you are lowered so you aren't fighting drag when you pull it.
content.location: Start under the big roof to the left of Altaworld

content.description: Awesome movement on somewhat dirty limestone. With more traffic this would clean up and be a 5 star route, I would advise a helmet for your belayer as you will encounter loose rock on the initial 30 feet, and smaller rock on the bulk of it. One of the most aesthetic lines at Hellgate.
content.location: Altaworld buttress, up the hill to the northwest of the Clamshell, look for the prominent arete with the large roof.
